thread.title: Gilmore self-funds to sustain nearly invisible campaign
thread.title_full: Gilmore self-funds to sustain nearly invisible campaign - POLITICO

author: Glenn Thrush
title: Gilmore self-funds to sustain nearly invisible campaign
text:
Former Virginia Gov. Jim Gilmore plowed $43,000 of his own money into his nearly nonexistent presidential bid, just under half of his total haul for the three-month period that ended Oct. 1, according to a new campaign-finance report. Twenty-nine other donors combined to help Gilmore raise $106,000 — a substantially lower sum than even other bottom-tier candidates were expected to announce.
His campaign spent $71,000 — the bulk of which, $40,000, went toward the South Carolina filing fee — leaving him with about $34,000 on hand heading into the final quarter of 2015. His only other significant expenses include $5,000 for a state director in New Hampshire — Richard Lowrance — and $5,000 to Marcus Consulting, whose principal Boyd Marcus also worked on the campaign of Democrat Terry McAuliffe, a defection that infuriated Republicans at the time.
